case_title: Investigation into Allegations of Bribery and Favouritism in Procurement of Uniforms by Pristina Airport

introduction: A Kosovo Trust Agency (KTA) Internal Audit Unit (IAU) Internal Memorandum dated 4 October 2004 raised concerns regarding the procurement of staff uniforms by Pristina Airport.
applicable_laws_and_procedural_rules: Provisional Criminal Code of Kosovo – Article 343 'Accepting Bribes'; Article 344 'Giving Bribes'

Finance Administration Instruction No. 2/1999 (Revised 15 December 1999) – Public Procurement Using Kosovo Consolidated Budget Funds – Section 4.3.2 – 'Avoidance of Conflicts of Interest and Corruption'

Finance Administration Instruction No. 2/1999 (Revised 15 December 1999) – Public Procurement Using Kosovo Consolidated Budget Funds – Section 4.1 'Full and Fair Competition'; Section 23.9 'Examination and Evaluation of Tenders'
Provisional Criminal Code of Kosovo – Article 161 'Threat'
methodology: The ITF commenced an inquiry into the allegations regarding the procurement process.
background_information: Vendor 1 Manager alleged bribery involving Procurement Officer 1 and the Finance Officer by Vendor 2 during the tender process.
investigation_details: Procurement Officer 1 managed the competitive tender for the supply of uniforms, with Vendor 1, Vendor 2, and Vendor 3 submitting bids.
The Bid Evaluation Committee tentatively decided in favor of Vendor 2, but the tender was later canceled by Pristina Airport Official.
conclusions: The ITF did not find evidence to support the allegations of bribery against Procurement Officer 1 and the Finance Officer.
The rationale for replacing a member of the Bid Evaluation Committee was reasonable.
The Finance Officer's participation in the committee was not deemed unprofessional.
No evidence was found to support the claim that Procurement Officer 1 favored Vendor 2.
recommendations: It is recommended that UNMIK Pillar IV inform Procurement Officer 1 and the Finance Officer that no wrongdoing was found.
It is recommended that UNMIK provide this report to the Department of Justice and the Financial Investigation Unit for information purposes.
